full_text: Page 835 Re: Epstein update From (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) To (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) Date 2019/08/10 11:42 Subject: Re: Epstein update Attachments: TEXT.htm Hi (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) MCC Administrators have been in touch with (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) at the USMS since early this morning. I too have been in touch with (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) since a little after 9 am, at which time I shared the limited information I had. The press release is the sum total of the information we have at this time pending the investigation. I am going into the secure perimeter to see if there is more information to share, but please be advised that some of what I get may be shared with your office but not further since it is an open investigation. Thank you, (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) Supervisory Staff Attorney CLC New York Metropolitan Correctional Center 150 Park Row New York, New York 10007 p: (646)836 (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) f. (646)836-7665 >>> (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) (USANYS) (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) @usdoj.gov> 8/10/2019 11:30 AM >>> It is frankly unbelievable to me that BOP is issuing public press releases on this before telling us basic information so that we can relay it to his attorneys who can relay it to his family. When can we expect to get either some sort of statement we can pass along to counsel as accurate and reliable or have a call with someone? I understand from the Marshals that they have been unsuccessful in reaching anyone with authority at BOP, and given the BOP press release that was just put out I assume we need to speak with someone there. Please advise. Thank you. (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) On Aug 10, 2019, at 10:43 (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) (USANYS) (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) @usa.doj.gov> wrote: (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) As you might imagine, we are getting increasingly frantic calls from defense counsel who continue to be seeing information in the press that we the US Attorney's Office haven't yet Page 1509 DOJ-OGR-00025146

text_blocks.content: Re: Epstein update From (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) To (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) Date 2019/08/10 11:42 Subject: Re: Epstein update Attachments: TEXT.htm

Hi (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) MCC Administrators have been in touch with (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) at the USMS since early this morning. I too have been in touch with (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) since a little after 9 am, at which time I shared the limited information I had. The press release is the sum total of the information we have at this time pending the investigation. I am going into the secure perimeter to see if there is more information to share, but please be advised that some of what I get may be shared with your office but not further since it is an open investigation.
Thank you, (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) Supervisory Staff Attorney CLC New York Metropolitan Correctional Center 150 Park Row New York, New York 10007 p: (646)836 (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) f. (646)836-7665

>>> (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) (USANYS) (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) @usdoj.gov> 8/10/2019 11:30 AM >>> It is frankly unbelievable to me that BOP is issuing public press releases on this before telling us basic information so that we can relay it to his attorneys who can relay it to his family. When can we expect to get either some sort of statement we can pass along to counsel as accurate and reliable or have a call with someone?

I understand from the Marshals that they have been unsuccessful in reaching anyone with authority at BOP, and given the BOP press release that was just put out I assume we need to speak with someone there. Please advise.
As you might imagine, we are getting increasingly frantic calls from defense counsel who continue to be seeing information in the press that we the US Attorney's Office haven't yet

additional_notes: The document is an email chain discussing the Epstein update. The email contains redactions marked as (b)(6); (b)(7)(C). The document is from page 835 and continues to page 1509.
